ovdesc.p: This table is developed to establish a secure messaging system in a bank.
It helps to post messages between bank user to customer. It provides a facility to define messages
and updated with a status for each messages that has been posted.

desc.p: Specifies Message from / to the customer.
TEXT field. This field contains body of the messge.
Specifies time when the message is sent.
Noinput field. This field will be updated when the message is authorised.
Specifies status of the message. Default is UNREAD.
It has two options. They are UNREAD and READ.
This field specifies the record ID of parent message.
This field contains the subject of the message to be sent or received.
Must be a valid record id on department account officer table. Account Offcier to which the message to be sent.
For external user, list of allowed DAO for messageing will be populated in this field.Otherwise, it is noinput field.
It holds the record key of EB.SECURE.MESSAGE. System generated.
Must be a valid record id on customer table. Customer to which the message to be sent.
Noinput field if the message is triggered from external user.
This field specifies status of the received message. Default is SENT.
It has two options. They are SENT and UNSENT.
It holds date when the message is read.
Noinput field. This field will be updated when the message is read by the receiver.
Holds the date when the message is sent.
Noinput field. This field will be updated when the message is authorised.
Input must be a valid record id on customer table. Customer from which the message is triggered.
Noinput field. External customer id will be populated for external users.
Must be a valid record id on department account officer table. Account Offcier from which the message is triggered.
DEPARTMENT.CODE on USER record will be populated if the message is triggered from internal users.
Holds the Image id when the upload attachment is required.
NoInput field. The record id of the IM.DOCUMENT.IMAGE record which the file being uploaded will be linked to.
The field uses a file browser to locate and display the file.
The field uses a file browser to locate and display the file.When the link button is clicked the file is both renamed and then downloaded to the storage path specified in the IM.DOCUMENT.TYPE.
